alices_adventures_in_wonderland.description: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland tells the story of a girl named Alice who falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar and anthropomorphic creatures. The tale plays with logic in ways that have given the story lasting popularity with adults as well as children. It is considered to be one of the most characteristic examples of the 'literary nonsense' genre, and its narrative course and structure have been enormously influential, especially in the fantasy genre

parts.title: A Caucus Race and a Long Tale
The Rabbit Sents in a Little Bill

alices_adventures_in_wonderland.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland

grimm_fairy_tales.description: A collection of German origin fairy tales first published in 1812 by Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, the Brothers Grimm. The collection is commonly known today as Grimms' Fairy Tales (German: Grimms MÃ¤rchen). Please note that some of the contents may not be suitable for younger listeners

hunting_of_the_snark.description: The Hunting of the Snark is a poem by Lewis Carroll describing the adventures of ten strange characters as they pursue the Snark.

through_the_looking_glass.description: The sequel to Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, where Alice ponders what the world is like on the other side of a mirror's reflection.
